abstract.t: This document describes a simple mapping database to be used by the Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) to find Endpoint Identifier (EID) to Routing Locator (RLOC) mappings. Termed the Alternative Logical Topology (ALT), the database is built as an overlay network on the public Internet using the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) and the Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE). Using these proven protocols, the ALT can be built and deployed relatively quickly without major changes to the existing routing infrastructure.
